Home Updated Friday, May 7

Hashtags

NationalBarbecueMonth copy

May is the month of backyard barbecues and many folks fire up their grills in celebration. Businesses to consider: BBQ Joints, Outdoor retailers who sell grills or patio furniture, or even shops that sell sauces or tools for grilling.

GardenPlanning copy

This hashtag works great in conjunction with content about Lawn and Garden Month or spring gardening.

NationalSalsaMonth copy

Grab your favorite chips, the month of May is National Salsa Month! Businesses to consider: Retailers who sell salsas, Mexican restaurants who offer salsa, plant shops or nurseries that sell tomato plants or other produce that can become salsa.

NationalSaladMonth copy

Crisp and refreshing salads are perfect as the weather heats up this summer. Grab your favorite dressing because May is National Salad Month.

Upcoming Topics

🛣
May–June

Roadtrip Season

End of May through June marks the beginning of roadtrip season. Auto businesses lean into vacation specials, oil changes, tire specials, rental vehicles, and more. RV and Camper sales were up a drastic amount in 2020 — while we may not see new purchases as high as last year, we're bound to see camper makeovers and a need to make traveling and working on the road easier for the whole family. #CamperRenovation #CamperLife #RoadTrippin 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Lean into prepping the family vehicle for long car rides. Ideas for entertaining littles in the car, car-approved snacks, and tips for roadside emergencies work great during this season. When posting for RV or Camper customers, consider small space hacks or tips for bringing work on the road. Showcasing local spots to visit for a long weekends help followers plan obtainable vacations without any huge commitments.
💸
May 17 Monday

Tax Day

Tax Day is traditionally known as the day on which individual income tax returns are due to be submitted to the federal government. Similar to last year, there has been an extension on Tax Day. It now falls on May 17. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    This content is useful for: Businesses that deal in financials, real estate agencies/brokers, retail spaces that capitalize on customers receiving tax returns.
⛳️
May 20–23

PGA Championship

The PGA Championship is an annual golf tournament conducted by the Professional Golfers' Association of America. It is one of the four major championships in professional golf. Learn more »

  • Posting Recommendation
    Please view KB guidelines for trademark phrases to avoid.
🦷
Entire Month May

National Dental Care Awareness Month

During the month of May, National Dental Care Month takes time to remind us of the importance of caring for our pearly whites. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    The start of the summer is a great time for a cleaning or preventative dental work. With events like graduations, family reunions. and vacations coming up, making sure your smile is in top shape is crucial.
🏡
Entire Month May

Spring Housing Market

Spring is typically the best time to prep for the busy real estate marekt ahead (March - June). A few things folks do to prepare: renovate the backyard, tackle spring cleaning and decluttering (the first step to staging a home), explore areas for potential rental properties. 

🌷
Entire Month May

Backyard Projects

Spring is the best time to start backyard projects like pool installations or new landscaping before summer. #backyardreno 

🤧
Entire Month May

Allergy Season

Seasonal allergies can occur year-round for some, but many experience symptoms in the spring when allergens like mold spores and pollen from trees, grasses, or weeds are released into the air. Trees begin producing pollen early in spring, followed by grass later on in the season. A particularly rainy spring season can also result in more rapid plant growth, leading to a spike in mold spores around this time. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Pets who spend time outside can experience seasonal allergy symptoms. Do your health and wellness customers specialize in allergens or have an allergist on staff? Keep in mind not to promote "cures or remedies" to avoid breaking FB's content guidelines.
🎓
Entire Month May

Graduation Season

Starting in May many HS and college seniors are likely to celebrate their graduation with backyard parties, zoom/virtual celebrations, and planning senior trips after graduation. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    This content is especially relevant for Restaurant, Florists, Beauty (Salon and Spa), and Retail customers.
🏡
Trending

Hosting From Home

While virtual meetups aren't going anywhere, folks are looking forward to hosting close family and friends in the somewhat near future. Think spruced up social spaces, fresh furniture ideas, and tips to get all that clutter under control. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    People are planning—and purchasing—for their post-quarantine lives. Consider how your customers can help. Think furniture DIY and inspo, potential first meals they'll serve, and outdoor living spaces.
🥰
Trending

Values Matter Most

The pandemic has put everyone in touch with what matters. People are more grounded in their values than ever—and they want the world to see it. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Does your customer mention any particular values in their welcome call or in their brand kit? Are they passionate about the planet and making eco-conscious decisions? Do they work with the local community in any way to give back?
🎀
Trending

Best Dressed

Loungewear may still reign supreme, but people are planning for future events. Weddings, vacations, casual get-togethers are top-of-mind for many. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    How can your customer help those planning for their first events post-quarantine? Think eretail or businesses in the wedding industry.
👰
Trending

Wedding Season

June is typically considered peak wedding season. Couples will be finalizing details and arranging the final touches of their big day. Many potential wedding guests are already thinking about what they'll wear and how they'll travel to venues. The industry is seeing many rescheduled wedding due to Covid-19 and leading to some being downsized or changed before the event. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    A few things to consider this season: The rise in micro weddings (under 50 people), wedding gifts, dress cleaning/tailoring, video venue tours, photography sessions, and catering events/tastings.
🏋️‍♂️
Trending

Everyday Wellness

A shift to natural, shorter movement being incorporated thorughout the day rather than spending hours in the gym is on the rise. Activiites like biking, cleaning, and gardening set a new exercise model for many. Look to promote movement as accessible activities that can be attainably woven through the week. 

🌅
Trending

Morning Rituals

The time spent at home in the past year has allowed folks to fine-tune their morning routines. With many gaining minutes to hours back in their day from the time not spent commuting, there's been a shift in focus on how to spend the first hours of the day. Breakfast is making a big comeback for many. Morning workouts, mediations, and yoga flows allow folks to start their day with less stress and more focus. Specialty coffee drinks made from an at-home coffee bar have found their place too. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Do your health and wellness customers offer online meditations or yoga flows to tune into? Or maybe coffee shops offer a barista class or want to hear about the kinds of drinks folks have been trying to master at home. Think about how your customers can make morning routines that much more enjoyable for consumers.
👩‍🍳
Trending

Anyone Can Cook

Limited dining options and quarantine in 2020 taught many folks how to take the fate of weeknight dinners into their own hands. In 2021, we're seeing the result of millions of home chefs flexing their skills and wanting to push their kitchen-prowess further. From new cookbooks to viral Tik Tok recipes, we'll see the cooking community come together more and more this year. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    How can you engage with at-home chefs or those looking to expand their palate.
🍲
Trending

Meal Prep Comeback

During quarantine, many loosened up their strict meal prep routines. However, we're seeing more and more folks ease back into meal prep. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    At the core of meal prep is the sentiment of being prepped and prepared for the week. How can your customers help consumers achieve this?
🌱
Trending

Gardeners Rejoice

This horticultural hobby shows no signs of slowing down this year. While May is peak gardening season, now is the time to plan and plant early crops. Things like herb gardens, home-grown produce, and perfecting lawn care will all be top of mind. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Do your customers offer any gardening services, weed/pest control services, or tips for yard maintenance? Maybe they can offer ways to use home-grown veggies in healthy recipes or guidance around the stress relieving properties of gardening.
✈️
Trending

Travel Planning

70% of consumers are planning vacations this year. That means a larger audience for our consumers to connect with. Weekend trips or staycations are trending this year likely in more rural or secluded destinations. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Now's the time to showcase the value our travel customers have to offer. Why choose their services? Why choose to stay with them rather than a brand they've stayed with before? Look to specific services or details about your travel customers that help them stand out. Also don't be afraid to think outside the box when it comes to travel planning (think boarding pets, vehicle storage, packing tips, or guides to local areas).
🏫
Trending

End of the School Year

The end of the school year symbolically kicks off the summer season for many families in the US. Timing varies across country. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Prep for summer vacations, summer camps, swimming lessons, and outdoor activities kicks off early-mid may. Businesses tend to lean into start of summer specials and promotions to capitalize on the need for new summer clothing, activities, and travel.
🖥
Trending

Home offices

Looks like remote work is a permanent, accessible solution for many! Home offices are going to be a priority for home buyers. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Think of the educational content your customer could offer about home office design trends -- soothing colors, natural decor, access to sunlight/fresh air, or even smart tech solutions. Engage with followers by asking your audience to share details about their home office spaces.

Holidays

🇺🇸‍
Monday May 31

Memorial Day

Memorial Day is a federal holiday commemorating the people who died while serving in the country's armed forces. It also marks the unofficial start of the summer vacation season. Since this day has two (tonally very different) meanings in American culture, it’s customary to honor this day in a multitude of ways. Some participate in community parades, which are tributes to those who have died while serving (like ceremonies at memorials and cemeteries or tribute concerts). Some celebrate the kick-off to summer with outdoor BBQs, spending time in the sunshine, or vacations. 

  • Posting Recommendation
    Avoid scheduling content on Memorial Day unless requested by the customer.
